articles.headline: Senate and House Leaders Call for Inquiry of Russian Hacking in Election
articles.snippet: Senator Mitch McConnell and Speaker Paul D. Ryan said they supported the investigations, setting up a possible conflict with President-elect Trump.
articles.abstract: Senator Mitch McConnell and Speaker Paul D. Ryan said they supported the investigations, setting up a possible conflict with President-elect Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The top two Republicans in Congress said on Monday that they supported investigations into possible Russian cyberattacks to influence the American election, setting up a potential confrontation with President-elect Donald J. Trump in his first days in office.

articles.headline: Aleppo Close to Falling Under Complete Control of Syrian Government
articles.snippet: Government forces and their allies have squeezed fighters and civilians in rebel-held parts of the city into a sliver of territory, spokesmen said.
articles.abstract: Government forces and their allies have squeezed fighters and civilians in rebel-held parts of the city into a sliver of territory, spokesmen said.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — The siege in Aleppo is almost over.

articles.headline: New Approach to Corporate Tax Law Has House G.O.P. Support
articles.snippet: A business tax overhaul championed by a Berkeley professor could advance President-elect Donald J. Trump’s job-creation agenda without tariffs or presidential deal-making.
articles.abstract: A business tax overhaul championed by a Berkeley professor could advance President-elect Donald J. Trump’s job-creation agenda without tariffs or presidential deal-making.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump has vowed to protect and create American manufacturing jobs, even threatening high tariffs on imports to help achieve that goal. So far, though, his plan seems to lean heavily on one-at-a-time deals, like the one struck late last month to save jobs at the Carrier plant in Indianapolis.

articles.headline: Elizabeth Warren Condemns the Wrong Man
articles.snippet: The Massachusetts senator recently attacked the hedge fund manager Whitney Tilson in a Facebook post, despite his support of her and new financial industry regulations.
articles.abstract: The Massachusetts senator recently attacked the hedge fund manager Whitney Tilson in a Facebook post, despite his support of her and new financial industry regulations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Elizabeth Warren, furious about President-elect Donald J. Trump’s appointments of finance industry insiders, took to Facebook a little over a week ago to fire off a message to her nearly 2.5 million followers.

articles.headline: Michael Flynn Is Harsh Judge of C.I.A.’s Role
articles.snippet: Mr. Flynn’s view that the C.I.A. is a political arm of the Obama administration isn’t widely shared in Washington but seems to have been internalized by Donald J. Trump.
articles.abstract: Mr. Flynn’s view that the C.I.A. is a political arm of the Obama administration isn’t widely shared in Washington but seems to have been internalized by Donald J. Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Long before Lt. Gen. Michael T. Flynn became Donald J. Trump’s choice for national security adviser, he believed that the Central Intelligence Agency had become a political tool of the Obama administration — a view now echoed by the president-elect in his mocking dismissals of C.I.A. assessments that Russia sought to tip the election in Mr. Trump’s favor.

articles.headline: Rex Tillerson, Exxon C.E.O., Chosen as Secretary of State
articles.snippet: In choosing the leader of an energy giant, President-elect Donald J. Trump is dismissing bipartisan concerns that Mr. Tillerson is too cozy with Vladimir V. Putin.
articles.abstract: In choosing the leader of an energy giant, President-elect Donald J. Trump is dismissing bipartisan concerns that Mr. Tillerson is too cozy with Vladimir V. Putin.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump on Tuesday officially selected Rex W. Tillerson, the chief executive of Exxon Mobil, to be his secretary of state. In saying he will nominate Mr. Tillerson, the president-elect is dismissing bipartisan concerns that the globe-trotting leader of an energy giant has a too-cozy relationship with Vladimir V. Putin, the president of Russia.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Alabama Prosecutor Sets the Penalties and Fills the Coffers
articles.snippet: In the city of Dothan, one man’s grip on the criminal justice system has exacted a steep price for many.
articles.abstract: In the city of Dothan, one man’s grip on the criminal justice system has exacted a steep price for many.
articles.lead_paragraph: DOTHAN, Ala. — It was a run-of-the-mill keg party in an open field, until one guest, Harvey Drayton Burch III, objected to paying for his beer. Witnesses said Mr. Burch fired a gun over the crowd and began spraying Mace. With partyers fleeing, Mr. Burch jumped into the back seat of a car as it drove away.
articles.byline: By Shaila Dewan and Andrew W. Lehren

articles.headline: Where Were Trump’s Votes? Where the Jobs Weren’t
articles.snippet: Donald Trump won the support of blue-collar whites outside urban areas in part because nearly all the gains from the economic recovery passed them by.
articles.abstract: Donald Trump won the support of blue-collar whites outside urban areas in part because nearly all the gains from the economic recovery passed them by.
articles.lead_paragraph: Did the white working class vote its economic interests?

articles.headline: Battle Over Aleppo Is Over, Russia Says, as Evacuation Deal Reached
articles.snippet: After a four-year battle, the last rebel fighters agreed to turn over their territory. The United Nations reported that scores were killed as pro-government forces moved in.
articles.abstract: After a four-year battle, the last rebel fighters agreed to turn over their territory. The United Nations reported that scores were killed as pro-government forces moved in.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Russia declared on Tuesday that the four-year battle over Aleppo, Syria’s largest city, was over, as the last remaining rebel fighters agreed to turn over their territory to the Syrian government. While pro-government forces were moving in, United Nations officials said they were receiving multiple reports of execution-style killings.

articles.headline: An (Edible) Solution to Extend Produce’s Shelf Life
articles.snippet: A start-up, Apeel, has developed an alternative to the wax and other tricks growers use to keep produce fresh longer. It may also reduce food waste.
articles.abstract: A start-up, Apeel, has developed an alternative to the wax and other tricks growers use to keep produce fresh longer. It may also reduce food waste.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. — What if a Florida tomato could be left on the vine long enough to turn red and fully develop its flavor — and still be ripe and juicy when it arrived at a grocery store in New York days later?

articles.headline: Rick Perry, Ex-Governor of Texas, Is Trump’s Pick as Energy Secretary
articles.snippet: Mr. Perry is an enthusiastic supporter of oil and gas extraction, but the Energy Department is far more focused on national security and basic science.
articles.abstract: Mr. Perry is an enthusiastic supporter of oil and gas extraction, but the Energy Department is far more focused on national security and basic science.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump plans to name Rick Perry, the former governor of Texas, to lead the Energy Department, an agency far more devoted to national security and basic science than to the extraction of fossil fuels that is Mr. Perry’s expertise.

articles.headline: A Trump Economic Boom? The Fed May Stand in the Way
articles.snippet: The more President-elect Donald J. Trump stimulates growth, the faster the Federal Reserve is likely to increase rates to avoid overheating the economy.
articles.abstract: The more President-elect Donald J. Trump stimulates growth, the faster the Federal Reserve is likely to increase rates to avoid overheating the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Investors in financial markets, and those predicting faster economic growth in 2017, would do well to remember the famous words that William McChesney Martin Jr., the former Federal Reserve chairman, uttered way back in 1955: The Fed’s job is to remove the punch bowl just as the party gets going.
